p: Twenty-five percentage of antidepressant drugs prescribed by doctors are obtained from herbs through various extracts (Saki et al. 2014). To estimate the important compounds contributing to the antidepressant effect, Saki et al. ( 2014) performed an electronic database based study. The results revealed that terpenes formed a major part of the extracts of medicinal plants that exerted antidepressant effects (Saki et al. 2014). Thus, scientists focused on identifying the active principles of plant extracts contributing to the antistress effects. Different plant had different acting compounds.
